definition: front sight (firearms)/the zero point indicator marked on a steelyard

sentences.english: Position the crosshair to select a difference and press fire when you're done.
sentences.chinese: 選擇一個十字準星位置差異和按火當你做了。

sentences.english: I can hurl tennis rackets at small moving objects with deadly accuracy.
sentences.chinese: 用網球拍投擲移動的小東西，我準星挺高。

sentences.english: Yes. The new crosshair has a small center dot with the standard 4 "legs."
sentences.chinese: 有，全新的準星有4個豎條，中間是一個小點。

sentences.english: Fixed sights have luminous inserts for low light conditions.
sentences.chinese: 固定的準星有發光嵌件用於低照度條件。

sentences.english: Mechanically he reached for the empty gun, drew a bead, and pulled the trigger.
sentences.chinese: 他機械地抓起了那支空槍，瞄好準星，摳下板機。

sentences.english: The crosshair will expand when the player is moving.
sentences.chinese: 當玩家移動的時候，準星會擴張。

sentences.english: I rather doubt you could trust its aim,” he said.
sentences.chinese: 我很懷疑有人敢相信它的準星。

sentences.english: When you've aligned the notch on the gun with the target, fire!
sentences.chinese: 當你把槍的準星和目標對齊，那就開火。

sentences.english: The crosshair is reduced to a dot.
Tao gets up to have no a gun sight.

definition: (military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
Phelps (name)/Michael Phelps (1985-), US swimmer and multiple Olympic gold medallist
Jeremy Lin (1988-), Taiwanese-American professional basketball player (NBA)
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
